snippet: Candidates for the White House should be judged on areas where a president can effect change, but the surge in gas prices isn’t one of them, says Richard H. Thaler.
abstract: Richard H Thaler Economic View column explains the economic theory behind the fluctuation of gasoline prices and contends that the president of the United States has no impact on those prices; calls for candidates to be judged on areas where a president can actually make a difference and urges them to stop blaming Pres Obama for rising gas prices.
lead_paragraph: Candidates for the White House should be judged on areas where a president can effect change, but the surge in gas prices isn’t one of them, says Richard H. Thaler.

headline.print_headline: Why Gas Prices Are Out of Any President’s Control
headline.seo: Gas Prices Are Out of Any President’s Control
headline.main: Why Gas Prices Are Out of Any President’s Control
